intro: Zehntnerella polygona, commonly known as the many-flowered zehntnerella, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Zehntnerella polygona is noted for its delicate appearance and is often found in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
